title: KMOS WP9 Building the KMOS Spectrographs (Revised)
abstractText: The University of Oxford is part of an international consortium building the KMOS instrument for the ESO VLT in Chile. KMOS will allow Infra-red spectra to be taken of up to 24 stars and external galaxies simultaneously. Oxford is building the three identical spectrographs of the KMOS instrument. Each of the spectrographs must operate at very low temperatures to reduce instrument background, We will be designing specialised optics and mechanisms as part of the spectrograph to allow operation at low temperature and at wavelengths between 0.9microns and 2.5 microns well to the red of the optical spectrum. Please note: new pay arrangements have yet to be implemented
impactText: KMOS is now operational on the VLT  Cultural,Societal,Economic
findingsText:
We built the spectrographs for a second generation instrument of the ESO VLT. 

We produced one of the very first infrared spectrographs with multiple deployable integral field units. ESO community have access to this instrument to advance astronomy. Education
